subSections.title: Readings
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|簪}} {{wikipedia|Kanzashi}} [[File:Fukuyu with willow kanzashi.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|簪}} (''kanzashi''): A {{m|ja|舞子|tr=maiko||apprentice ''geisha''}} with the [[willow]]-themed '''kanzashi''' for the month of June.]] {{commonscat|Kanzashi}}
{{IPAchar|/kamusaɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/kanzaɕi/}} Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=かんざし|髪|tr1=kamu|t1=hair, hair of the head|pos1={{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かんざし}} combining form|挿し|tr2=sashi|t2=sticker-through (something that sticks through)|pos2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{ja-l|挿す}} ''sasu'' “to stick through, to insert”}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}{{R:Daijirin}} {{rendaku2|sort=かんざし|sashi|zashi}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かんざし}}

# a [[hairpin]], particularly a [[fancy]] [[decorative]] hairpin used in Japanese women's [[hairstyle]]s

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text:
This is most commonly spelled in kanji as {{ja-l|簪}} or in kana as {{ja-l|かんざし}}.

The alternative kanji spellings are attested, but seldom used in modern {{etyl|ja|-}}.
